activities.loc: MDB Check Monitor & Posted Calendar for Courtroom

result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Bruce K Kolberg

records.addlTxt:
Defendant shall be fingerprinted at the Barron County Sheriff's Dept., if not already done.
If represented by the Public Defender and does not have a phone, must contact the Public Defender weekly at 715-908-8473. 

Defendant must maintain absolute sobriety.
Must not possess or consume alcoholic beverages. 
Must not possess or consume controlled substances or drug paraphernalia except as prescribed by licensed physician.

1:30 PM Defendant Bruce K Kolberg appeared by video, in custody.  Prosecuting attorney Brian H. Wright Aty in court for the State of Wisconsin. 

Defendant must call the public defender's office today to determine eligibility.  If the defendant does not qualify for public defender representation, the defendant must complete a Petition for Appointment of an Attorney, Affidavit of Indigency also known as the blue form in order for the court to consider appointing an attorney. 


(Bond and MS scanned to jail)
Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for November 9, 2022 at 10:00 am.
